data.chText: （因绝望而）不惜冒险的，不顾一切的，拼命的
data.enText: feeling or showing that you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or others

data.chText: 犯人因绝望而越来越胆大妄为。
data.enText: The prisoners grew increasingly desperate.

data.chText: 两年来销路不畅，商店不惜冒起险来。
data.enText: Stores are getting desperate after two years of poor sales.

data.chText: 那外面有个男人又冷又饿，还有人抓他，走投无路了。
data.enText: Somewhere out there was a desperate man, cold, hungry, hunted.

data.chText: 我听到隔壁房间里有拼命挣扎的声音。
data.enText: I heard sounds of a desperate struggle in the next room.

data.chText: 绝望的；孤注一掷的；铤而走险的
data.enText: giving little hope of success; tried when everything else has failed

data.chText: 孤注一掷争取自由的努力
data.enText: a desperate bid for freedom

data.chText: 为了活命，她拼命抓住边缘。
data.enText: She clung to the edge in a desperate attempt to save herself.

data.chText: 不断增加的经济困难迫使他采取了铤而走险的办法。
data.enText: His increasing financial difficulties forced him to take desperate measures .

data.chText: 医生们不惜一切地奋力抢救小女孩的生命。
data.enText: Doctors were fighting a desperate battle to save the little girl's life.

data.chText: 非常需要；极想；渴望
data.enText: needing or wanting sth very much

data.chText: 他当时太想找份工作了，什么事都愿意干。
data.enText: He was so desperate for a job he would have done anything.

data.chText: 我极想见到她。
data.enText: I was absolutely desperate to see her.

data.chText: 我很想抽支烟。
data.enText: I'm desperate for a cigarette.

data.chText: 极严重的；极危险的；很危急的
data.enText: extremely serious or dangerous

data.chText: 这些孩子非常需要爱心和关怀。
data.enText: The children are in desperate need of love and attention.

data.chText: 他们面临无污染水源的严重短缺。
data.enText: They face a desperate shortage of clean water.

data.chText: 病得厉害；极为不快；极其孤独
data.enText: desperately ill/unhappy/lonely

data.chText: 他深深地吸了口气，竭尽全力保持镇定。
data.enText: He took a deep breath, desperately trying to keep calm.

data.chText: 他们非常想要一个孩子。
data.enText: They desperately wanted a child.

data.chText: 她在四下里找，急于弄到一件武器。
data.enText: She looked desperately around for a weapon.

word_means: 不惜冒险的，不顾一切的，拼命的
simple_means.memory_skill: de 否定 + sper 希望 + ate 具有…的 → 没有希望 → 绝望的

means: (因绝望而)不惜冒险的，不顾一切的，拼命的

ex.zh: 变得不顾一切（或迫切渴望、极为严重）

tr: a person who is frightened and in need of help
example: they prey on the hopes of the desperate

tr: especially of actions courageously undertaken in desperation as a last resort
example: made a last desperate attempt to reach the climber
the desperate gallantry of our naval task forces marked the turning point in the Pacific war"- G.C.Marshal
they took heroic measures to save his life
on all fronts the Allies were in a desperate situation due to lack of materiel"- G.C.Marshal

tr: showing extreme urgency or intensity especially because of great need or desire
example: felt a desperate urge to confess

tr: arising from or marked by despair or loss of hope
example: a despairing view of the world situation
the last despairing plea of the condemned criminal
helpless and desperate--as if at the end of his tether

tr: (of persons) dangerously reckless or violent as from urgency or despair

value.def: If you are desperate, you are in such a bad situation that you are willing to try anything to change it.

example.ex: Troops are needed to help get food into Kosovo where people are in desperate need...
example.tran: 需要军队帮助将科索沃人民亟需的食品送抵那里。

example.ex: Desperate with anxiety, Bob and Hans searched the whole house...
example.tran: 焦急万分的鲍勃和汉斯把整座房子找了个遍。

example.ex: He made a desperate attempt to hijack a plane.
example.tran: 他铤而走险，企图劫持一架飞机。

value.tran: （因绝望而）孤注一掷的，铤而走险的，拼命的

example.ex: Thousands are desperately trying to leave their battered homes.
example.tran: 成千上万的人不顾一切地想要离开他们千疮百孔的家园。

value.def: If you are desperate for something or desperate to do something, you want or need it very much indeed.

example.ex: They'd been married nearly four years and June was desperate to start a family...
example.tran: 他们结婚已快4年了，琼非常渴望要个孩子。

example.ex: People are desperate for him to do something.
example.tran: 人们极希望他能做点什么。

gramarinfo.label: v-link ADJ, usu ADJ to-inf, ADJ <l>for</l> n

example.ex: He was a boy who desperately needed affection.
example.tran: 他是一个极需要关爱的男孩。

value.def: A desperate situation is very difficult, serious, or dangerous.

example.ex: India's United Nations ambassador said the situation is desperate...
example.tran: 印度驻联合国大使说形势非常危急。

example.ex: I decided not to abandon John when he was in such a desperate position.
example.tran: 我决定不在约翰走投无路的时候抛弃他。

value.tran: 极困难的;极严重的;极危险的

trans: 变得不顾一切（或迫切渴望、极为严重）

partsOfSpeech.dec: de 否定 + spair〔=sper〕希望 → 不抱希望 → 绝望
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ado → 没有希望无所顾忌 → 亡命徒
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ate 具有…的 → 没有希望 → 绝望的
de 否定 + sper 希望 + ation，desperate 的名词 → 绝望
pro 在前 + sper 希望 → 希望在前 → 繁荣
pro 在前 + sper 希望 + ity，prosper 的名词 → 繁荣昌盛
pro 在前 + sper 希望 + ous …的，prosper的形容词 → 繁荣的
